forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 5pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Southwest wind around 13 mph. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5am, then a chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy. Low around 53, with temperatures rising to around 55 overnight. West southwest wind 10 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
Downtown San Francisco is currently enveloped in a kind of muted elegance typical of autumn in the Bay. The clouds hang low, cloaking the day in a subdued gray palette, while the promise of rain builds with the afternoon’s approach. As we inch towards evening, expect the skies to weep gently, a precursory drizzle leading into steadier rains that will dominate the night.

The view from the higher points of the city reveals a haze over the bay, hinting at the moisture that lingers in the air. Though the late afternoon temperatures hover around a comfortable 62 degrees, a brisk southwest wind introduces a chill, compelling you to reach for layers—a lightweight jacket or a cozy sweater is advisable. Straying too far from shelters may invite unexpected droplets, so perhaps an indoor adventure awaits. Consider immersing yourself in the warmth of a nearby café, sipping on a hot brew while listening to the soft patter of rain outside. Or, if you’re feeling adventurous, grab an umbrella and stroll through the quieter streets, where the air smells of impending rain and the city seems poised for a fresh start.
